programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Return of the Mogul's Return
programme.desc: Jarrod goes bidding with a hangover which Brandi fears will hold him back, while Dave will not let a fight with Laura keep him away from an auction.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A customer offers the team a gambling set - complete with concealed weapons - while Chumlee questions the value of a Snoop Dogg doll.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Chumlee takes over from Antwaun as the shop's security guard, while the team values a drum from the American Civil War and a motorcycle club uniform.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Pawn Stars' Rick Dale and his team take delivery of a unique scale model of a 1932 Hudson car, embarking on a museum-quality makeover.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and his team restore a vintage arcade boxing game.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: The heaviest lift in two seasons pushes Jamie and the team to their limits, leaving them struggling to complete the rescue and get traffic on the Coquihalla Highway moving again.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: A man who can survive a 35ft belly-flop into a pool of water, a sauna champion capable of withstanding extreme heat and the world's fastest gunslinger.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: Detectives talk to a host of suspects when the dismembered body of a chef is discovered.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams trawl scrap metal heaps for bargain Japanese car parts. While one tackles a Subaru Impreza, the other strips a Mitsubishi Lancer Evo.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley challenges Seth to a unique competition in the shop, and should he lose, the one thing he has been trying to keep a secret will be revealed.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les loses his temper when the kids suggest he should sell their failing second store, while Seth decides to put a sneaky plan into action.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Danielle search through a scrapyard and a 19th-century ghost town, and find a classic car with a famous Hollywood history.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Part two of two. Zachary Quinto continues his quest to prove that the city of Atlantis not only existed, but was a thriving empire.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: An investigation into an unusual object spotted over Chicago's O'Hare International Airport in 2006, asking whether aliens are watching Earth's aviation industry.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Pawn Stars' Rick Dale and his team take delivery of a unique scale model of a 1932 Hudson car, embarking on a museum-quality makeover.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick and his team restore a vintage arcade boxing game.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Customers offer the team some spooky artefacts during Halloween, including a 19th-century vampire-killing kit and a set of equipment used in paranormal investigations.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team tries to get a good price on a fighter jet, as well as a baseball bat and glove signed by acclaimed player Babe Ruth.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell tries to learn more about the mysterious Mogul, Jarrod and Brandi try not to let Dave distract them, and Ivy makes a find that leads to an adventure on the high seas.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon return to a town where they have always enjoyed good luck in the past - but this time, Dave is the one who comes out on top.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Ashley challenges Seth to a unique competition in the shop, and should he lose, the one thing he has been trying to keep a secret will be revealed.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les loses his temper when the kids suggest he should sell their failing second store, while Seth decides to put a sneaky plan into action.

programme.title: Forged in Fire
programme.desc: Four bladesmiths must create a blade out of high carbon steel while also forging the hammer they will use to make it.

programme.title: America's Book of Secrets
programme.desc: A look at the secret measures employed by US authorities to monitor the thousands of potential terrorists thought to be operating on American soil.

programme.title: UFO Hunters
programme.desc: An investigation into accounts by witnesses who allegedly saw military helicopters transporting a UFO in Needles, California, in 2008.

programme.title: In Search Of
programme.desc: Zachary Quinto explores the terrifying concept of mind control, meeting an alleged victim implanted with an electronic harassment device in his head.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Seth's plan to sell the Pontiac shop hits a snag and Ashley is pulled into the fray, and a meeting with a potential buyer leaves them facing a life-changing situation.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Pilot of the series following colourful life in a large pawn shop, as run by the Gold family. From alligators to false limbs, its staff has no idea what could come through the door next, and profits come with a huge risk.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: Deep in the Heart of Upland
programme.desc: A surprise visitor from Texas attends the latest heated round of auctions, which goes badly for the bidders but ends in a spectacular climax.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dan and Laura have a crisis on their hands, and Brandi tries to make sure Jarrod focuses on the auctions.

programme.title: Wicked Tuna
programme.desc: The crews battle for territory as they begin to work out the blue fin hotspots, but teams clash and tempers begin to flare as they head to the same part of the ocean.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Experts visit an ancient fortress in Peru believed to have been built by aliens using tools far more advanced than those thought to have been available to humans at the time.

programme.title: Search for the Lost Giants
programme.desc: Brothers Jim and Bill Vieira investigate accounts of giant skeletons being found across America, to determine if these stories are true and who the bones belonged to.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell tries to learn more about the mysterious Mogul, Jarrod and Brandi try not to let Dave distract them, and Ivy makes a find that leads to an adventure on the high seas.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell and Brandon return to a town where they have always enjoyed good luck in the past - but this time, Dave is the one who comes out on top.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Panellists Rich Hall, Sean Lock, Jo Brand and Alan Davies answer questions on catseyes, camels and centurions, with host Stephen Fry awarding points for the answers he finds most interesting.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by radio presenter Sara Cox, comedian Jason Manford, journalist Nick Robinson and actor Harry Shearer, who aim to help the team captains deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by comedy actors Warwick Davis and Hugh Dennis, comedian Katherine Ryan and journalist John Simpson, who aim to help the team captains deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig and regular panellist Alan Davies are joined by Aisling Bea, Lee Mack, Jason Manford to answer questions on the subject of peril. As ever, correctness and even intelligence go out of the window as the panellists attempt to answer the fiendishly difficult questions, with points invariably awarded for the answers the questionmaster finds most interesting, as opposed to correct.

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.desc: Tandy sets up a alarm system in the house, unaware Melissa has put her own security precautions in place. Plus, the whole group decides the time is right for a change of scenery.

programme.title: The Last Man on Earth
programme.desc: A post-apocalyptic road trip places everyone at odds with each other, and pushes Gail to her breaking point. Comedy, starring Will Forte and Kristen Schaal.

programme.title: Judge Romesh
programme.desc: A desperate father begs Judge Romesh not to let his son run off to the circus and a mother is sick and tired of her daughter bringing 'bad juju' into the house.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Cops UK: Bodycam Squad
programme.desc: Rookie Bodycam Cop Laura heads out to make her first arrest as a newly qualified police officer and James is called to a disturbance on a quiet residential street.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike Wolfe and Frank Fritz have their work cut out for them on a huge property, which includes a collection of more custom 1932 Fords than they have ever seen in one place.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: Sean Kelly and the bidders head to Blackpool Pleasure Beach, where Nat and John gamble on a mode of transport, and an unpopular bargain hunter returns to the group.

programme.title: Storage Hunters UK
programme.desc: In Oxford, John goes against his wife's advice and ends up in a conflict with Dan, while Linda thinks she has spotted something the other bidders are yet to see, and George and Rupert take a risk on mysterious items hidden under dust sheets. Presented by Sean Kelly.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: The guys get the pick of a lifetime at a famous tourist attraction, plus a collector in Cape Cod shuts down a deal until his wife steps in.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank continue their search for abandoned treasures. But when they bump into hard negotiator Big Moe, Mike is left feeling very small.

programme.title: Jay Leno's Garage
programme.desc: Jay and Jeff Dunham race some fast amphibious cars, before Jay boards a huge Navy hovercraft.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May put three supercars through their paces in Italy. Their weapons of choice are the 691bhp Lamborghini Aventador, McLaren's hi-tech MP4-12C, and a British brute in the form of the Noble M600. The journey begins at Nardo, a high-speed testing ground so vast it can be seen from space, and includes a nerve-racking drive in Rome before reaching its conclusion with a timed challenge against the Stig at the Imola circuit. The trio are also joined by The Voice mentor Will.i am, who takes the wheel of the Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and James May travel to Beijing to learn about China's car industry, which has seen great expansion in recent years - but also have a violent encounter with one of the Stig's cousins. Meanwhile, Richard Hammond immerses himself in the world of Nascar at a race in Texas, and the Mercedes-Benz SLS AMG Roadster is wrestled around the test track, emitting serious amounts of noise and smoke in the process. Future host Matt LeBlanc is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Timber Kings
programme.desc: Peter battles the elements to build a retirement home for two childhood sweethearts, and Bryan Jr does a build for his wife Tabby.

programme.title: Cop Car Workshop
programme.desc: Head of Fleet Services John Heussi and his team redesign the vehicles that transport the dog units, turning a humble Ford Mondeo into a Dog Van.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson and Richard Hammond take charge of shooting a car chase for a film version of The Sweeney, assisting with the stunt-driving choreography and the direction of lead actors Ray Winstone and Ben Drew. James May takes the Vauxhall Corsa VXR Nurburgring for a run around the test track, and delivers his verdict on the updated Fiat Panda. Hollywood actor Ryan Reynolds is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car.

programme.title: Top Gear
programme.desc: Jeremy Clarkson, Richard Hammond and James May work on a project to build mobility scooters capable of tackling the British countryside's terrain, and actor Michael Fassbender is the Star in a Reasonably Priced Car. Ferrari's four-wheel-drive FF is pitted against the revised, V8-engined Bentley Continental GT on a test track at the edge of the Arctic Circle, while James puts the Fisker Karma through its paces in Florida, and meets AC/DC frontman Brian Johnson.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by actors Kevin Bishop and Brian Blessed, comedian Josh Widdicombe and historian Kate Williams, who aim to help the team captains deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captains David Mitchell and Lee Mack are joined by guest players Rhod Gilbert, Jamie Laing, Tracy-Ann Oberman and Claudia Winkleman, who aim to deceive their opponents with plausible lies. Hosted by Rob Brydon.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Panellists Rich Hall, Sean Lock, Jo Brand and Alan Davies answer questions on catseyes, camels and centurions, with host Stephen Fry awarding points for the answers he finds most interesting.

programme.title: QI
programme.desc: Sandi Toksvig and regular panellist Alan Davies are joined by Jimmy Carr, Gyles Brandreth and Sally Phillips, who answer questions on the subject of piecemeal, with points awarded for the answers the host finds most interesting.

programme.title: Hypothetical
programme.desc: Matt Forde, Kerry Godliman, Rosie Jones and Romesh Ranganathan are posed increasingly absurd hypothetical situations. Hosted by Josh Widdicombe and James Acaster.

programme.title: Dave Gorman: Terms and Conditions Apply
programme.desc: Using his trademark, powerpoint-comedy and mischievous games, Dave invites David O'Doherty, Rose Matafeo and Ed Gamble to help him make sense of the world.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: A squeak on Granville's bike interferes with his hopes of romance, and Arkwright worries about a mysterious visitor to a house in Atkinson Terrace.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: How to Ignite Your Errand Boy
programme.desc: Arkwright decides to make his own product, unhappy at the amount of profit lost to middlemen, and instructs Granville to come up with a suitable idea for something that is in daily demand, yet cheap and simple to make. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright has a rival for Nurse Gladys Emmanuel's attention, as a visitor from Australia - and an old flame of hers- returns to his old stomping ground.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The story of America's â€˜Liberty Ships', which were produced in incredible numbers and became known as the Model T Fords of the ocean.

programme.title: Battle Factory
programme.desc: The documentary continues with a look at an aluminum parajet used by the military, drug enforcement agencies and first responders, and a hovercraft made using PVC panels filled with air.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Medieval Dead
programme.desc: Carbon dating of a skeleton found in East Sussex suggests the bones are from the Norman era, leading experts to consider whether the medieval man fought at the Battle of Hastings.

programme.title: Hitler's Miracle Weapons
programme.desc: Unusual weapons created by German scientists during the Second World War, including giant cannons, V2 rockets and a 200-ton tank, and how they influenced future arms developments.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Property magnate Paul Whight invites Tony Robinson and the team to investigate his stately home in Essex to learn more about the De Veres, better known as the Earls of Oxford, who once lived there. In an in-depth search of the building and garden, the archaeologists gradually make discoveries that shed light on the history of the home and the aristocratic family.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to Kenfig, south Wales, to search for the remains of the once-thriving harbour town believed to have been buried beneath sand dunes in a series of storms more than 500 years ago. The archaeologists have only three days to determine the size of the lost community and search for evidence of the battles between the locals and the Anglo-Norman settlers.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The remarkable story of how Stalin's massive war factories were dismantled and moved east on one and half million railway trucks, to avoid being lost to the Nazis.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: The story of a bear that fought alongside the Polish army, which became a terrifying modern myth among the German army during the Second World War.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: How engineers have built railways across mountains, including tunnels through the Swiss Alps and an Australian track that runs up a near-vertical cliff face.

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team head to Kenfig, south Wales, to search for the remains of the once-thriving harbour town believed to have been buried beneath sand dunes in a series of storms more than 500 years ago. The archaeologists have only three days to determine the size of the lost community and search for evidence of the battles between the locals and the Anglo-Norman settlers.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough highlights the curiosities that have led to accusations of forgery, but have ultimately helped assist the rethinking of evolution. When early explorers brought the first specimen of a duck-billed platypus to England in 1799, it was considered so bizarre it was deemed a hoax. Similarly, the midwife toad became the centre of a scientific storm in the 1920s that led to accusations of fakery.

programme.title: David Attenborough's Natural Curiosities
programme.desc: David Attenborough encounters two species with wrinkly skin, where nature has tinkered with the ageing process to different effect. The mole rat retains its looks while growing old and the elephant looks old from birth, yet both creatures live relatively long lives.

programme.title: The Life of Mammals
programme.desc: David Attenborough profiles the tree-dwellers of the animal kingdom, as primates, bats and squirrels perform complicated manoeuvres in the world's forests. Whether aided by sharp claws, webbed feet or gripping tails, these animals play a complicated game of survival with predators lurking below, ready to make a meal of those who fail to stay aloft.

programme.title: Impossible Engineering
programme.desc: The spacecraft designed for the first manned mission to Mars, planned to launch by 2035, which requires the most powerful rocket ever built and a specially designed crew module.

programme.title: World War Weird
programme.desc: The story of a bear that fought alongside the Polish army, which became a terrifying modern myth among the German army during the Second World War.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The remarkable story of how Stalin's massive war factories were dismantled and moved east on one and half million railway trucks, to avoid being lost to the Nazis.

programme.title: Impossible Railways
programme.desc: Unusual rail networks designed to traverse water, including the Indian Ocean, the earthquake zones of the Bosphorus Strait and the sea cliffs of the Italian Riviera.

programme.title: Trains That Changed the World
programme.desc: The railroads ended slavery in the USA, but trains can be agents of oppression too. The British Empire built railways to rule the world, enabling it to control the empire.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: A squeak on Granville's bike interferes with his hopes of romance, and Arkwright worries about a mysterious visitor to a house in Atkinson Terrace.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: How to Ignite Your Errand Boy
programme.desc: Arkwright decides to make his own product, unhappy at the amount of profit lost to middlemen, and instructs Granville to come up with a suitable idea for something that is in daily demand, yet cheap and simple to make. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Arkwright has a rival for Nurse Gladys Emmanuel's attention, as a visitor from Australia - and an old flame of hers- returns to his old stomping ground.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki is asked to give evidence at the appeal of convicted murderer David Bennetto, and when her testimony leads to his release, she ends up locking horns with DI Rachel Klein, who put the man away six years earlier. It seems the detective is right when another young man is found dead at the scene of the original crime. Has Nikki helped to free a serial killer? Emilia Fox stars, with appearances from Tobias Menzies, Michael Socha and Aaron McCusker.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The successful spring collection brings a surprise proposal for the future that threatens the sisters' partnership.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: An antique Berber rug spells intrigue for the roguish dealer, leading him into a world of unrequited love and umbrella stands. Meanwhile, Lady Jane splits from her husband after refusing to accompany him to Hong Kong for his new job. Virginia McKenna guest stars.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The net starts to tighten around Ralph Saroyan when more is discovered about his secret financial dealings. Meanwhile, Evie's affair with Treasury Minister Lord Montford threatens the future of the company, and Bea's marriage continues to flounder.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The men take part in a bridge building exercise to improve morale. Meanwhile in London, Lieutenant Colonel Osbourne fights for the future of the King's Fusiliers.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: The company take up their new posting in Germany, and rivalry between the two amalgamated regiments soon follows. Starring Robson Green.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Amanda Mealing joins the cast as consultant Connie Beauchamp, who immediately gets on the wrong side of Will. Ric spends the day flirting with the new arrival - before she reminds him exactly who is in charge. Owen feels confused over Diane and Mubbs' conflicting advice, while Donna comes to the rescue of a drunken and distraught Mickie, who makes a surprising confession.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Part two of two. Sheelagh reacts with disgust when Lance suggests Conor may have been behind the bombing - until a shocking discovery compels her to reassess her relationship with her son. Andrea's return to the station prompts Neil to cast aside all restraint, and eager new CID recruit Gary Best goes missing during an undercover assignment, forcing Ken and Rob to embark on a desperate hunt for him. Jack declares his love for Rachel, and it seems Adam could be heading for a court appearance when he refuses to retract his allegations about Jerome Taylor.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Struggling to come to terms with Conor's revelation about his sexuality, Sheelagh tries to build bridges with him - only to be floored by another shocking discovery. Irene Radford is implicated in an arson attack on an ice cream van, but it seems she will escape justice yet again when the van owner dies in suspicious circumstances. Jack angrily dismisses Debbie's concerns about his relationship with Rachel, but she refuses to take a hint and arranges a set-up to catch her out.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Clyde is running out of places to hide, and Michelle and Rachel seem to be his last hope.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: It's Halloween and as the children go trick or treating around the Square, police searching for Clyde pay a visit to Michelle and Rachel.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Henry Reeve-Jones vows to find the person who leaked the story of Holby's investment in an arms-making company to the press, putting Laura on edge. A 75-year old woman is shot in the foot after an unlikely family reunion turns sour and staff treat a Curdish azylum seeker injured while on hunger strike.

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: The Rev Harry Nettles bets the antiques dealer that a field next to a church contains a Roman mosaic. Drama, guest starring David Kossoff, with Ian McShane and Dudley Sutton.

programme.title: Bergerac
programme.desc: A holiday-maker enjoys the attention his mugging attracts, but his vivid imagination impedes Jim's investigations. Police drama, guest starring Norman Wisdom.

programme.title: Bread
programme.desc: Joey's past returns to haunt him. Billy finds himself in trouble with the law and Freddie is notable by his absence.

programme.title: Are You Being Served?
programme.desc: Mrs Slocombe takes charge of the department while Mr Rumbold is off sick, leading to friction with the staff. Shop-floor comedy, with John Inman, Mollie Sugden and Frank Thornton.

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: In an attempt to spite Lionel, Jean decides to make a play for his publisher Alistair. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Chaos abounds at an annual parade held to celebrate a famous battle. The lifelike effigy of the old General has been spruced up and Nora Batty prepares to sit on a float playing the part of his wife. Norman Wisdom makes a cameo appearance.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: Part one of two. Deed reluctantly helps Jo by examining why funding for legal aid was withdrawn in the case of a soldier who committed suicide after being damaged by army vaccines. However, he risks causing a constitutional crisis when he decides the only way to win justice for the deceased's family is to accuse the original judge of bias.

programme.title: Judge John Deed
programme.desc: Part two of two. Deed's investigation into why a soldier's legal funding to sue a pharmaceutical company was withdrawn leads to more sinister discoveries. Forces begin to work against him with shocking consequences. Legal drama, starring Martin Shaw, Jenny Seagrove and Donald Sinden.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The unsolved murder of pornographer Jim Hockney is reopened when his daughter Sara provides DNA proof he wasn't her father. The team tries to track down jazz singer Angela Gold, who was the victim's girlfriend at the time and disappeared from the music scene after being acquitted of the crime, and it's Brian's replacement Danny Griffin (Nicholas Lyndhurst) who manages to find her. However, with Angela professing her innocence and Sara's mother Jane also arousing suspicion, it becomes a struggle to determine who is telling the truth. With a guest appearance by former Corrie killer Brian Capron.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki and Jack travel to Scotland to examine the body of a lap dancer found in a remote forest, and the search for a suspect brings them into conflict with a couple of rogue city cops. However, when more remains are discovered, it becomes clear they are looking for a serial killer - and news of the crimes preys deeply on the mind of a young mother who is harbouring a dark secret. Emilia Fox and David Caves star, with appearances from Martin Compston (Line of Duty) and Gary Lewis (Billy Elliot).

programme.title: Dickinson's Real Deal
programme.desc: David Dickinson and the team are in Lincoln, where Helen Gardiner comes across an unusual item found at the back of a seller's garage, and a rare medal goes under the hammer.

programme.title: The Switch
programme.desc: Quiz hosted by Sanjeev Bhaskar in which players four contestants can accumulate big cash totals by answering questions in a series of rounds that alternate between easy and hard, before one gets to the final stage and the chance to double the prize pot.

programme.title: Tipping Point
programme.desc: Game show, hosted by Ben Shephard, in which contestants answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the greater the prize fund. The player who has won the least amount is then eliminated, and the last one standing competes for a Â£10,000 jackpot.

programme.title: Cash Trapped

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars

programme.desc: Ron Pitts presents footage of diners being hit by a tornado and bus crashes.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: Tempers flare between the loggers, and a massive beaver dam is removed when it creates flooding in the swamp.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: How to blow the world's finest crystal, make the slimmest TVs, heat the deepest swimming pool, and fill a million bottles a day of the world's favourite ketchup.

programme.desc: Excitement builds when the team make a discovery on the island, but a series of dangerous encounters threaten the mission and people's lives.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Sam Lovegrove are in Yorkshire looking at a collection of Triumph motorcycles that are a bit out of their price range. However, something else may be of interest.

programme.title: Shed and Buried
programme.desc: Bike guru Henry Cole and ace mechanic Sam Lovegrove visit a shop hoping to sell a bike and get side-tracked by the wares on offer. Will they manage to find some good bargains amongst all the delights?.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer sources a 181 Thing from a collector, but is forced to dig deep for the purchase, meaning there is not much money left in the kitty for Edd China's repair job.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part one of two. Edd China gets to work on an old VW camper van, changing the exhaust and completing a diesel service.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Work on the camper van is completed, and the finished article proves very popular when it is snapped up by a buyer straight away.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: After chasing one for 38 years, Wayne Carini finally acquired a Hudson Italia from a woman called Hazel, who might have more surprises in store for the enthusiast.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer finds a rare, rust-free model of a Datsun 240Z California and Edd China swaps the auto for manual transmission, before the pair try to make a profit.

programme.title: Live Snooker: Scottish Open
programme.desc: The afternoon session on day three of the ranking tournament at Emirates Arena in Glasgow, where the second-round matches get under way.

programme.title: Autobahn
programme.desc: A look at the Bundesautobahn 2 in Germany, one of Europe's busiest, most dangerous and most important highways. For many people it's their place of work, and many more use it to travel across Europe.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer visits Idaho to buy a Karmann Ghia, but a broken gearbox and damaged interior could stop him and Edd China from making a profit on the sale of the restored vehicle.

programme.title: Outback Opal Hunters
programme.desc: The mining season is almost over and Col's crew takes one last gamble opal-spotting from the air. The Cooke brothers strive to save their mega opal machine and disastrous season.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: At an antiques centre in Gloucestershire, Drew Pritchard finds a valuable item overlooked by the rest of the trade. Later, he digs out lost treasures on a Kent country estate.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard heads to a manor house in Oxfordshire, where the classic exterior hides a weird and wonderful interior in which he hopes to uncover some priceless gems.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters: Bitesize
programme.desc: Experienced salvage hunter Drew Pritchard looks back at some of the most memorable finds and interesting characters he's encountered while hunting for items for his shop in Conwy.

programme.title: EFL on Quest
programme.desc: A round-up of goals and highlights from the English Football League. including Wigan Athletic v West Bromwich Albion and Swansea City v Blackburn Rovers.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: Officers reveal a sophisticated burglary with estimated losses of Â£8million when they investigate why a bank manager is unable to open his vault.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The forensic evidence presented in the OJ Simpson trial - the murder investigation and subsequent televised trial that took America by storm.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of millionaire entrepreneur Rick Chance, who was brutally gunned down in a hotel room. To catch the killer, detectives turned to surveillance video for help.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of 62-year-old Narleen Campton, who was found murdered in her home, apparently having been tortured, during Thanksgiving 2011 in Newport, Washington. Though Jeremy Bryant confessed to his involvement, doubt remains over whether he acted alone.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of New Jersey state trooper Phillip Lamanco, whose killers were connected to terrorism.

programme.title: Animal Cops Phoenix
programme.desc: Emergency animal medical technician AJ Meadows battles to save seven dogs locked in an overheated car with no food or water.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris takes us into the world of one of Sydney's busiest vets. A labrador is brought in with bulging eyeballs, and 60-year-old tortoise Hugo needs a mate.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Two brides are torn between a sexy look or a traditional one - and a disapproving father knows which he would prefer to see his daughter wearing.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Kristin wants to find a rock 'n' roll wedding dress, while Amber has two priorities - an outfit that is different and which shows off her tattoos.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: A customer needs to lose 20 to 30 pounds to fit into a dress, while another bride tries to convince Lori to let her try on a gown that is beyond her budget.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Chris Brown, one of Sydney's busiest veterinarians, performs a state-of-the-art operation on an out-of-control bulldog.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Australian vet Chris Brown comes to the aid of a golden retriever and a record-breaking goat.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: A man is suspected of violence toward three cats, and a dog whose vision was being restricted by its matted fur receives help.

programme.title: Animal Cops Philadelphia
programme.desc: A dead horse is found at a farm in northern Pennsylvania, where 13 other horses are living in dreadful conditions. Plus, an emaciated dog and a cat with a large tumour are treated. Documentary following the work of the SPCA's Humane Law Enforcement team, which investigates cases of animal cruelty.

programme.title: Celebrity Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah Moore and Jay Blades search the homes of former athletes Iwan Thomas and Danny Crates, in search of old items they can take away and transform to raise money for charity.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: The tools of detection are at the forefront of technology. This programme reveals the groundbreaking techniques being employed to catch deadly killers.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The case of outgoing 23-year-old Brandi Wells, who vanished in Longview, Texas, shortly after heading for a nightclub in August 2006. Her car was later found abandoned on a major interstate.

programme.title: Disappeared
programme.desc: The disappearance of Amy St Laurent after a night out with friends in October 2001. Investigators suspected Jeffery Gorman, who Amy had met at a club, of either kidnapping or killing her, but had insufficient evidence to press charges. However, Gorman later made a full murder confession in a telephone call to his mother.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Lavina has walked down the aisle 15 times as a bridesmaid, and now it is finally her turn to be the bride, while staff member Jennifer makes a series of rookie mistakes.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Hard-to-please bride Rene brings along her even pickier mother, while Nnenna's mum grows tired of her daughter's indecision.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Margaret talks about missing her deceased mother as she shops for a wedding dress, while Emily feels lucky to have her mum's support.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Atlanta
programme.desc: Caitlyn has no intention of sharing the spotlight while shopping for a dress, while Mojdeh is convinced her consultant will not be able to help.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride drops a bombshell which leaves one of her wedding party in tears. Meanwhile, another bride fights her mother over the choice of dress.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Bridesmaids
programme.desc: A bride learns quickly that her family is not always on her side, while another struggles to get any opinions on dresses from her wedding party.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A customer finds shopping with her opinionated mother challenging.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress: Big Bliss
programme.desc: A customer tries to bond with her estranged half-sister while shopping for a dress, and a bride looks for the perfect gown to impress her fiance.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard discovers treasures in an Oxfordshire brewery, and drives a hard bargain with a fairground fanatic in Essex.

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Jay Blades is at Walsall Recycling Centre, where he saves a set of lathe tools, a sofa and a collection of plant pots in the hope of breathing new life into them.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Part one of two. Destinee never felt like she fit in, as she was born Matthew. She has come out as a transgender woman, but needs to lose some of her 600 pound-weight, so she can fully transition.

programme.desc: Identical twins enlist Lisa's help to unlock the mystery of why they were placed for adoption. Chris acts on a deceased father's wish to find his son..

programme.desc: Doctors operate on a woman suffering extreme stomach pains, and discover the world's biggest ovarian cyst.
